benchmark_details.name: DisKnE (Disease Knowledge Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: DisKnE is a new benchmark for evaluating biomedical language models' disease knowledge. It explicitly addresses the limitations of previous datasets, allowing for assessments of medical reasoning with clear training-test splits designed to avoid knowledge leakage.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the disease-centred knowledge captured by pre-trained language models and evaluate their reasoning capabilities.

data.source: Derived from MedNLI and MEDIQA-NLI using manual annotation and adversarial example generation.
data.annotation: Manually annotated with types of medical reasoning and adversarial perturbation for negative examples.

methodology.calculation: F1 score is calculated for the positive class across different categories.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance of the models in reasoning tasks related to disease knowledge.
methodology.baseline_results: ClinicalBERT, BioBERT, SciBERT, and BERT were evaluated on the benchmark with varied performance in terms of F1 across categories.
methodology.validation: The evaluation involved detailed performance analysis of various language models on the benchmark.
